15:55 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <msmeria> has quit  
15:58 <vfzevaze> hi! i wrote a macro in groovy to list redmine issues on xwiki and i would like to give it back to the community, which is the best way to do it? Where to document such stuff that is too small to be called an extension... i gues...  
15:58 <cjd> Small extensions are still welcome  
15:59 <cjd> but if you don't want to publish it as a XAR extension (which would be preferable because it could be installed with extension manager) you still have the option of installing as a snippet  
15:59 <vfzevaze> Okay, so just document them a lá snippet style on extensions.xwiki.org ?  
16:00 <cjd> err s/installing/publishing/  
16:00 <cjd> that's not the best but it's ok  
16:01 <cjd> if it's just one page with a unique name, it should be fine  
16:01 <vfzevaze> ok, with or without a sapce for it?  
16:02 <vfzevaze> \*space  
16:02 <cjd> if it's many pages in the XWiki space or pages with names that might collide with usernames, you might consider porting it to it's own space  
16:02 <vfzevaze> two pages  
16:02 <cjd> on the other hand, we'd rather have a pretty good extension than none at all :)  
16:02 <cjd> so use good judgement  
16:02 <vfzevaze> a oen space it is  
16:03 <cjd> and making a .xar file and publishing on extensions.xwiki.org benefits you too because you can install it on another wiki in the future using just the extension manager  
16:03 <vfzevaze> alright, i will do just so  
16:04 <vfzevaze> how to create a config page for an extension so the users dont have to edit the macro?  
16:05 <cjd> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise2xCycle#HEasierdevelopmentofconfigurableapplicationsusingXWiki.ConfigurableClass  
16:05 <cjd> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Administration+Application#HMakingyourapplicationeasilyconfigurablewithConfigurableClass28SinceEnterprise2.3M129  
16:06 <vfzevaze> yeah!  
16:06 <vfzevaze> thanks alot  
16:06 <cjd> sure thing
